intro: Silybum squarrosum, commonly known as the thistle bush or squarrosum thistle, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is characterized by its spiny, lobed leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in summer. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is often found in rocky or disturbed soils. Its leaves are covered in fine, white hairs, giving them a silvery appearance. Silybum squarrosum is typically perennial, with a robust root system that allows it to thrive in arid conditions.
